Subsection Title: Facilities Agreement") providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €214,300,000, which was
Subsubsection Title: Guarantees and security
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement is guaranteed by the Company, and certain other members of the Group (as defined below) and will be secured by the same Collateral that will secure the Notes and the Notes Guarantees, in each case subject to certain limitations due to applicable corporate law and contractual provisions. The Senior Facilities Agreement further provides that the aggregate of earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization of the Company and all other guarantors with positive EBITDA (calculated on the same basis as EBITDA (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement), before reallocation of intra-group items, in each case evidenced on the basis of the latest audited consolidated financial statements of the Company and its subsidiaries (in this description of the Senior Facilities Agreement, will be referred to as the "Group")) must represent at least 80% of the aggregate EBITDA (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) of the Group (before reallocation of intra-group items) determined annually on the basis of the audited consolidated annual financial statements of the Group but in each case excluding, among other things, any members of the Group incorporated in an Excluded Jurisdiction (as defined below) and, at the Company's discretion, any member of the Group that is not incorporated in the Netherlands, Germany, Norway, Finland, Sweden, England & Wales or Belgium (the "Guarantor Coverage Test"). No breach of the Guarantor Coverage Test will occur if within the agreed accession period, the Company procures that, subject to certain agreed security principles, additional members of the Group become guarantors under the Senior Facilities Agreement such that if they had been guarantors under the Senior Facilities Agreement on the reference date, the Guarantor Coverage Test would have been satisfied. The Guarantor Coverage Test will be tested annually as per the end of each financial year of the Company. The agreed accession period is 120 days and commences with the earlier of (i) receipt by the agent of the relevant annual financial statements and (ii) the date on which the annual financial statements are due to be delivered. Additionally, the Company must procure that each member of the Group which becomes, or any company acquired by a member of the Group which is, a Material Company (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) becomes a guarantor under the Senior Facilities Agreement and grants security as soon as reasonably practicable and in any event within 120 days of such company becoming a Material Company, or, as the case may be, being acquired. "Excluded Jurisdiction" means Russia, Ukraine or any (other) Sanctioned Country (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement). -----

Subsection Title: Facilities Agreement") providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €214,300,000, which was
Subsubsection Title: Voluntary cancellation and prepayment and mandatory prepayment
Subsubsection Text: The Company may, if it gives the facility agent at least five business days prior written notice, cancel the whole or, subject to a certain minimum cancellation amount, part of an available facility under the Senior Facilities Agreement. Any such cancellation will reduce the commitments of the lenders under the affected facility ratably. Each borrower may voluntarily prepay all or, subject to a certain minimum repayment amount, part of a utilization made available to it under the facilities under the Senior Facilities Agreement by giving at least three business days prior notice to the facility agent. Amounts prepaid in respect of Facility B under the Senior Facilities Agreement may not be reborrowed as the relevant commitments will be irrevocably cancelled. Any prepayment shall be made with accrued interest on the amount prepaid and, subject to breakage costs, without premium or penalty. Any such prepayment will be shared pro rata across the lenders under the affected facility under the Senior Facilities Agreement. In addition to voluntary prepayments, the Senior Facilities Agreement requires mandatory prepayment and cancellation of the Senior Facilities: - with respect to any lender, if it becomes unlawful in any applicable jurisdiction for such lender to perform any of its obligations, or to fund, issue or maintain its participation in any loan made available, under the Senior Facilities Agreement (or it becomes unlawful for any affiliate of a lender for that lender to do so); and - if a Change of Control or Sale (each as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) has occurred, with respect to any lender that requires prepayment within a 30-business day offer period commencing on the earlier of (i) the Company notifying the Agent of the event and (ii) the date on which the Lender becomes aware of the event. Subject to the timely exercise of its rights within such offer period, each lender will be entitled to require each borrower to repay such lender's participation in any utilizations to that borrower together with accrued and unpaid interest and any additional amounts accrued under the finance documents. Following the election of any lender to have its participation in any utilizations prepaid and cancelled following a Change of Control or Sale, the facility agent shall by not less than 30 days' notice to the Company cancel the commitments of that lender and declare the participation of that lender in all outstanding utilizations, together with accrued interest and all other amounts accrued under the finance documents to that lender, immediately due and payable. Subject to the provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement (where applicable), the Company must further ensure that the borrowers prepay loans and cancel available commitments in amounts equal to the applicable percentage (determined based on the Senior Secured Net Leverage) of certain disposal proceeds, listing process and excess cashflow to the extent applicable and subject to further conditions.

Subsection Title: Facilities Agreement") providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €214,300,000, which was
Subsubsection Title: Financial covenant
Subsubsection Text: In respect of each quarter date, the Company is required to confirm whether or not the Total Net Leverage (each as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) for the period of the most recent four consecutive financial quarters (subject to certain provisions and adjustments) exceeds 6.58:1 (the "Financial Covenant"). A breach of the Financial Covenant will be deemed cured if it is complied with when tested on the next quarter date and no notice of acceleration has been provided to the Company under the Senior Facilities Agreement in respect of that breach of the Financial Covenant prior to such quarter date. The Company is permitted to prevent or cure breaches of the Financial Covenant by electing to designate the proceeds from any new equity of the Company and new shareholder loans received by the Company as a cure amount. The Company may not make such election (i) more than four times during the life of the Senior Facilities Agreement (of which no more than two times may be EBITDA cures), or (ii) in consecutive testing periods. Moreover, in each period of four consecutive quarters there must be at least two quarters without a cure. A breach of the Financial Covenant may only be cured if the relevant equity or shareholder loan is actually received by the Company no later than twenty (20) Business Days after the date on which the relevant compliance certificate disclosing the breach was required to be delivered to the facility agent.

Subsection Title: Facilities Agreement") providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €214,300,000, which was
Subsubsection Title: Representations
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement contains certain representations and warranties (subject to certain specified exceptions and qualifications and with certain representations being repeated), including (i) status, (ii) binding obligations, (iii) non-conflict with other obligations, (iv) power and authority, (v) validity and admissibility in evidence, (vi) governing ----- law and enforcement, (vii) insolvency, (viii) no filings or stamp taxes, (ix) no deduction of tax, (x) no default, (xi) no breach of laws (xii) no misleading information in relation to certain information and documents provided to the facility agent and the other finance parties, (xiii) financial statements, (xiv) no proceedings pending or threatened, (xv) compliance with environmental laws, (xvi) taxation, (xvii) tax residence (xviii) ranking, (xix) good title to assets, (xx) legal and beneficial ownership of shares and assets subject to the security, (xxi) ownership of shares in material members of the group, (xxii) accounting reference date (xxiii) intellectual property, (xxiv) group structure chart, (xxv) acquisition documents, (xxvi) centre of main interests and establishments, (xxvii) holding companies, (xxviii) sanctions and (xxix) anti-corruption laws. Certain representations were made on the date of the Senior Facilities Agreement and on the Closing Date. Certain representations will be repeated on the date of each utilization request, and on the first day of each interest period.

Subsection Title: Facilities Agreement") providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €214,300,000, which was
Subsubsection Title: General undertakings
Subsubsection Text: We are subject to certain restrictive and, as the case may be, affirmative covenants under the Senior Facilities Agreement customary for these types of financing, which, in turn, are subject to certain specified exceptions and qualifications (customized to our business and adjusted to our current credit standing). The Senior Facilities Agreement will, in particular and without limitation, include restrictions and limitations (subject to exceptions, baskets and thresholds) on: - Mergers, amalgamations, demergers, consolidations or other corporate reorganizations; - Acquisitions and joint ventures; - Disposals; - Change of business; - Granting of security interests (negative pledge); - Making loans or extending credit; - Providing guarantees or indemnities; - Distributions, share redemption and payments on shareholder loans; - Financial indebtedness; and - Share capital.

Subsection Title: Facilities Agreement") providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €214,300,000, which was
Subsubsection Title: Events of default
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement contains certain events of default that are customary for such types of financing (subject to customary materiality qualifications and grace periods), including, without limitation: (i) non-payment of amounts due under the Senior Facilities Agreement and the other finance documents, (ii) breach of the Financial Covenant, (iii) breach of other obligations, (iv) misrepresentations, (v) cross default or cross acceleration, (vi) insolvency or insolvency proceedings, (vii) creditor's process, (viii) minimum share capital requirements of Italian obligors, (ix) unlawfulness and invalidity, (x) repudiation and rescission of agreements, (xi) breach of the Intercreditor Agreement, (xii) cessation of business, (xiii) audit qualification, (xiv) judgment, (xv) litigation, (xvi) expropriation and (xvii) occurrence of a material adverse change. The occurrence of any such event of default would, subject to any applicable grace periods or cure rights and agreed exceptions, entitle the facility agent (and the facility agent must do so if so directed by the Majority Lenders) by notice to the Company to (among other things): cancel their commitments, declare that all or part of the loans together with accrued interest and all other amounts accrued or outstanding under the finance documents be immediately due and payable and declare that all or any part of the amounts (including cash cover in respect of any outstanding amounts under the ancillary facilities) is immediately due and payable or payable on demand.

Subsection Title: Facilities Agreement") providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €214,300,000, which was
Subsubsection Title: Governing law
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it are governed by English law. -----

Subsection Title: Facilities Agreement") providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €214,300,000, which was
Subsubsection Text: increased from €179,300,000 by way of an uncommitted facility in an amount of €35,000,000 with the commitment date September 21, 2023 (the "Revolving Credit Facility"), a term loan facility in a principal aggregate amount of €1,450,000,000 ("Facility B") and an undrawn term loan facility in a principal aggregate amount of €200,000,000 available to finance the Acquisition ("Facility B1") (the Revolving Credit Facility, Facility B and Facility B1 are collectively referred to as the "Senior Facilities" for the purposes of this description). It is expected that a portion of the proceeds of the Offering will be used to repay and cancel a portion of Facility B, and that the commitments in respect of Facility B1 will be cancelled in full upon closing of the Offering. Facility B was fully drawn prior to the issue date and must be repaid in full on the termination date, being February 6, 2027. On September 21, 2023, the Issuer repaid and cancelled a portion of the Facility B in an amount equal to €200 million using the proceeds of the issuance of the Existing Notes. The Revolving Credit Facility may be drawn by the Company and any additional borrowers which may accede to the Senior Facilities Agreement subject to the conditions set out therein from February 6, 2020 (the "Closing Date") up to and including the date falling one month prior to the termination date. The Revolving Credit Facility will mature on the date falling six years and six months after the Closing Date, being on or around August 6, 2026. The purpose of the Revolving Credit Facility is to finance general corporate and working capital purposes of the Group including, without limitation, financing permitted acquisitions and permitted joint ventures, financing distributions and dividends which are permitted subject to compliance with a leverage ratio test and financing restructuring costs. The Revolving Credit Facility may be used for the drawing of loans in euro, or by way of ancillary facilities (in any other currency as agreed between the relevant ancillary lender and the Company) by the relevant lenders thereunder or an affiliate of such lenders. Any loan made available under the Revolving Credit Facility shall (subject to the operation of customary rollover mechanics) be repaid on the last day of its interest period and all amounts outstanding under the Revolving Credit Facility must be repaid on the termination date applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility. Facility B1 was committed pursuant to a facility notice dated March 8, 2024 and is undrawn. Facility B1 may only be utilized to finance or refinance the Acquisition and is expected to be cancelled upon closing of the Offering. In addition to the Revolving Credit Facility, Facility B and Facility B1, the Senior Facilities Agreement includes (in addition to other permissions under the limitation on indebtedness covenant) the ability to incur additional indebtedness (including under one or more uncommitted additional facilities within the Senior Facilities Agreement and/or any additional notes and/or other facilities or notes documented outside the Senior Facilities Agreement), provided that certain conditions are met including (a) a €25,000,000 minimum amount for uncommitted facility commitments and (b) a pro forma incurrence cap equal to the aggregate of: (i) the greater of (A) €205,400,000 and (B) an amount equal to 50 per cent. of Adjusted EBITDA preceding the date of incurrence (after giving pro forma effect to the relevant transaction); plus (ii) an unlimited amount at any time, where (A) Senior Secured Net Leverage (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) would not exceed 3.54:1 where the relevant Financial Indebtedness (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) constitutes Senior Facility Liabilities (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) or (B) in respect of Financial Indebtedness that does not constitute Senior Facility Liabilities and, (I) is unsecured, Fixed Charge Cover (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) would not be less than 2.00:1; and (II) is secured by Permitted Security (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) on a juniorranking basis on assets which are also encumbered by Transaction Security securing Senior Facility Liabilities on a seniorranking basis; and/or encumbering assets which are not subject to Transaction Security, Total Net Leverage (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) would not exceed 4.83:1 or (C) solely in respect of acquisition indebtedness (and including any available but undrawn commitments thereof), (I) Senior Secured Net Leverage (in respect of Financial Indebtedness constituting Senior Facility Liabilities); or (II) Total Net Leverage and Fixed Charge Cover (in respect of other Financial Indebtedness), would not be increased or decreased (as applicable) (each as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement), plus (iii) other than to the extent funded by long term financial indebtedness, the amount equal to certain voluntary prepayments, permanent cancellations and repurchases by a member of the Group of the facilities incurred under the Senior Facilities Agreement which constitutes a permitted debt purchase transaction thereunder, other permitted facilities or notes incurred which are documented outside the Senior Facilities Agreement, together with all voluntary prepayments of the ----- revolving facilities incurred under the Senior Facilities Agreement to the extent accompanied by a permanent reduction in the corresponding commitments.

On September 21, 2023, the Issuer issued €400.0 million in aggregate principal amount of 6.250% senior secured notes due 2029 (the "Existing Notes"), which remain outstanding as of the date of this Offering Memorandum. The Existing Notes are governed by the Existing Indenture. The Existing Notes mature on February 15, 2029. The Existing Notes will be guaranteed on a senior basis by the same entities that will guarantee the Notes and will be secured by the Collateral pari passu with the Notes. Prior to September 15, 2025, the Issuer will be entitled at its option to redeem all or a portion of the Existing Notes at a redemption price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the Existing Notes, plus the applicable "make whole" premium and accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts, if any, to, but excluding, the redemption date. Prior to September 15, 2025, the Issuer will be entitled at its option on one or more occasions to redeem no more than 40% of the original aggregate principal amount of the Existing Notes (including any additional Existing Notes) with the net cash proceeds from certain equity offerings at a redemption price equal to 106.250%, provided that, inter alia, at least 50% of the original aggregate principal amount of the Existing Notes (including any additional Existing Notes) remains outstanding. Prior to September 15, 2025, the Issuer may during each twelve-month period following the issue date of the Existing Notes redeem up to 10% of the original aggregate principal amount of the Existing Notes (including any additional Existing Notes) at a redemption price equal to 103% of the principal amount thereof plus accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts, if any, to, but excluding, the redemption date. On or after September 15, 2025, the Issuer will be entitled at its option to redeem all or a portion of the Existing Notes at the applicable redemption prices set forth below during the period beginning on September 15, of the year indicated below:

2025 .................................................................................................................................... 103.1250% 2026 .................................................................................................................................... 101.5625% 2027 and thereafter ............................................................................................................. 100.0000% In connection with any tender offer for the Existing Notes, if holders of not less than 90% in aggregate principal amount of the outstanding Existing Notes validly tender and do not withdraw such Existing Notes in such tender offer and the Issuer, or any third party making such a tender offer in lieu of the Issuer, purchases all of the Existing Notes validly tendered and not withdrawn by such holders, the Issuer or such third party will have the right to redeem the Existing Notes that remain outstanding in whole, but not in part, following such purchase at a price equal to the price offered to each other holder of Existing Notes in such tender offer. Upon the occurrence of certain defined events constituting a change of control, each holder of the Existing Notes may require the Issuer to repurchase all or a portion of its Existing Notes at a price equal to 101% of the principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts, if any, to the date of purchase. The Existing Indenture provides for covenants and events of default that are substantially similar in nature to the covenants and events of default set out under "Description of the Notes." The Existing Notes and the Existing Indenture are governed by the laws of the State of New York. The Existing Notes are listed and admitted to dealing on the Official List of the Exchange.
On December 21, 2023, the Issuer entered into an agreement with the European Investment Bank (the "EIB Loan

Subsection Title: Agreement") providing for a term loan of €100.0 million (the "EIB Facility") to finance the Group's investment program
Subsubsection Text: in electric equipment over the period 2023-2025. As of December 31, 2023, the EIB Facility was undrawn. As a condition precedent to drawing, the EIB Facility is expected to be guaranteed on a senior basis by the same entities that will guarantee the Notes and secured by the Collateral pari passu with the Notes. The EIB Loan Agreement provides for disbursement in up to three tranches, in a minimum principal amount of €30 million (or (if less) the entire undrawn balance), each of which may either be a fixed rate tranche or a floating rate ----- tranche. The disbursement notice in respect of each tranche shall specify the interest rate basis for the tranche, the repayment terms and the final maturity date. The EIB Loan Agreement provides for covenants and events of default that are substantially similar in nature to the covenants (including the financial covenant and guarantor coverage test described above) and events of default set out under "Senior Facilities Agreement." The EIB Loan Agreement includes notably a commitment to inform the European Investment Bank if a new financing arrangement (other than the Senior Facilities Agreement and the Existing Notes Indenture) includes covenants or other specified clauses that are more favorable to the relevant creditors than any equivalent provision in the EIB Loan Agreement, and if so requested by the European Investment Bank, to amend the EIB Loan Agreement so as to provide for equivalent provisions in favor of the European Investment Bank. The EIB Loan Agreement and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it are governed by Dutch law.

To establish the relative rights of certain of the Group's creditors under the Group's financing arrangements, the Trustee and certain other parties will accede on or before the Issue Date to an intercreditor agreement (the "Intercreditor

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: General
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement, inter alia, sets out: - the relative ranking of certain indebtedness and liabilities of the Debtors; - when payments can be made in respect of certain indebtedness of the Debtors; - when enforcement actions can be taken in respect of that indebtedness; - the terms pursuant to which certain indebtedness will be subordinated; - when enforcement actions can be taken in respect of the transaction security; - turnover provisions; - the order for applying proceeds from enforcement action and other amounts received by the Security Agent; and ----- - when the transaction security and guarantees will be released to permit a disposal of the collateral. For purposes of this description, "Senior Notes" shall include the Existing Notes, the Notes and any other notes, securities or other debt instruments issued or to be issued which are designated by the Issuer as "Senior Notes" under the Intercreditor Agreement. In this description, terms used but not defined herein shall have the meaning ascribed to them in the Intercreditor Agreement.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Ranking and priority
Subsubsection Text: Subject to certain exceptions, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that the liabilities owed by the Issuer and each other member of the Group that accedes to the Intercreditor Agreement from time to time as a debtor under the Intercreditor Agreement (together, the "Debtors") and each Third Party Security Provider to the following parties shall rank in right and priority of payment in the following order and are postponed and subordinated to any prior ranking Liabilities as follows: _first, (i) the agents, the arrangers, the lenders, the issuing banks, the ancillary lenders and the security agent each_ in its capacity as creditor or as applicable creditor in respect of the parallel debt obligations in relation to liabilities under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement, the EIB Loan Agreement or any other Senior Finance Document (together, the "Senior Facility Liabilities"), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior Noteholders (the "Senior Notes Liabilities") and (iii) the hedge counterparties under or in connection with the hedging agreements relating to Senior Facility Liabilities and Senior Notes Liabilities (the "Senior Hedging Liabilities") _pari passu and without any preference between them. The Senior Facility Liabilities, the Senior Notes Liabilities and the_ Senior Hedging Liabilities are together the "Senior Liabilities" and the creditors thereunder the "Senior Creditors" and _second, (i) the agents, the arrangers, the lenders, the issuing banks, the ancillary lenders and the security agent_ each in its capacity as creditor or as applicable creditor in respect of the parallel debt obligations in relation to liabilities under the Junior Finance Documents (the "Junior Facility Liabilities"), (ii) the trustee(s) in relation to any Junior Notes, the Security Agent and the Junior Noteholders (the "Junior Notes Liabilities") and (iii) the hedge counterparties under or in connection with the hedging agreements relating to Junior Facility Liabilities and Junior Notes Liabilities (the "Junior Hedging Liabilities")** _pari passu and without any preference between them. The Junior Facility Liabilities, the Junior Notes Liabilities and the Junior Hedging Liabilities are together the "Junior Liabilities" and the creditors thereunder the "Junior Creditors". The Intercreditor Agreement provides that the intra-group liabilities owed by one member of the Group to another member of the Group (other than any Shareholder Liabilities (as defined below)) (the "Intra-Group Liabilities") will be postponed and subordinated to the liabilities owed by the Debtors and Third Party Security Providers to the creditors under the Senior Liabilities and Junior Liabilities, (together with the relevant creditor representatives, the Security Agent and any receiver or delegate, the "Secured Parties"). The Intercreditor Agreement further provides that the liabilities ("Shareholder Liabilities") owed by any member of the Group to a direct or indirect shareholder of the Issuer or any subsidiary of such (direct or indirect shareholder) of the Issuer which is not a member of the Group under any loan made by it to the Issuer or any other member of the Group will be postponed and subordinated to the liabilities owed by the Debtors and Third Party Security Providers to the Secured Parties. The Intercreditor Agreement does not purport to rank any of the Intra-Group Liabilities or the Shareholder Liabilities as between themselves.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Transaction Security
Subsubsection Text: The Secured Parties benefit from the transaction security. Subject to certain exceptions and to the order of application of proceeds (see "—Application of proceeds" below), the transaction security shall rank and secure (but only to the extent such transaction security is expressed to secure those liabilities) the liabilities owed to first, the Senior Creditors _pari passu_ and without preference between them and second, the Junior Creditors _pari passu and without preference between them. In addition, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that the guarantees and transaction security will be released in certain circumstances described further below in "—Release of security—Non distressed disposals" and "—Release of _security and guarantees—distressed disposals."_

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Permitted Payments
Subsubsection Text: _Permitted payments in respect of the Senior Debt_ The Debtors and Third Party Security Providers may make payments in respect of the Senior Facility Liabilities and Senior Notes Liabilities (the creditors in respect thereof being the "Senior Debt Creditors"), at any time in accordance ----- with the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement, the Indenture for the Notes and any other Senior Debt Document (as applicable). _Permitted payments in respect of the Junior Debt_ Prior to the date on which the Senior Liabilities have been fully and finally discharged and the Senior Creditors are under no further obligation to provide financial accommodation to any of the Debtors under the Debt Documents (the "Senior Discharge Date"), the Debtors and Third Party Security Providers may make payments in respect of the Junior Liabilities: (a) if: (A) the payment is of i. any of the principal amount of the Junior Liabilities in accordance with (in the case of the Junior Facility Liabilities) the terms of the Junior Facility Agreements and (in the case of Junior Note Liabilities) the terms of the Junior Note Documents: 1. relating to provisions which are equivalent to illegality, right of cancellation and repayment in relation to a single lender or issuing bank under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement; 2. non-distressed disposals or mandatory prepayment of proceeds contemplated by the Intercreditor Agreement; 3. (only after the discharge in full of the Senior Debt Liabilities), relating to provisions which are equivalent to the partial prepayment clause relating to excess cashflow of the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement; or 4. any amount of principal or capitalized interest in respect of the Junior Note Liabilities which is not prohibited from being paid by the Senior Finance Documents and the Senior Note Documents; or ii. if the payment is of any other amount which is not an amount of principal or capitalized interest such other amounts including all scheduled interest payments (including, if applicable, special interest (or liquidated damages)) and default interest on the Junior Note Liabilities accrued and payable in cash in accordance with the terms of the relevant Junior Note Documents (as at the date of issue of the same or as amended in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and the other Debt Documents), additional amounts payable as a result of the tax gross-up provisions relating to the Junior Note Liabilities and amounts in respect of currency indemnities in the Junior Note Indenture; (B) no junior payment stop notice is outstanding; and (C) no payment default in relation to the Senior Liabilities has occurred and is continuing; (b) if the Majority Senior Creditors (as defined below) give prior consent to that payment being made; (c) if i. an event of default has occurred under (in the case of the Junior Facility Liabilities) a Junior Facility Agreement or (in the case of the Junior Note Liabilities) a Junior Note Indenture and is continuing and the payment is (in the case of the Junior Facility Liabilities) of junior restructuring costs or (in the case of the Junior Note Liabilities) of junior note restructuring costs, the common currency amount of which, when aggregated with the common currency amount of any other such amounts paid, does not exceed €2,500,000; and ii. no payment default in relation to the Senior Liabilities has occurred and is continuing; ----- (d) if the payments are of costs, commissions, taxes and expenses incurred in respect of (or reasonably incidental to) the Junior Note Documents (including in relation to any reporting or listing requirements under the relevant Junior Note Documents); (e) if the payments are of costs, commissions, taxes and any expenses incurred in respect of (or reasonably incidental to) any refinancing of the Junior Notes in compliance with the Intercreditor Agreement, the Senior Finance Documents and the Senior Note Documents; (f) if the payments are of Creditor Representative Amounts due and payable to the Junior Note Trustee, or (g) if the payment is by the Issuer of any of its obligations under a Junior Note Indenture and such payment is not directly or indirectly financed by any member of the Group except to the extent such payment would, if it had been a payment by a Debtor (other than the Issuer) or other member of the Group to a Junior Note Creditor, otherwise have been permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement. On or after the Senior Discharge Date, the Debtors and Third Party Security Providers may make payments to the Junior Creditors in respect of the Junior Liabilities in accordance with the Junior Finance Documents and the Junior Note Documents, as applicable.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Enforcement regime
Subsubsection Text: The enforcement regime set out in this section applies generally subject to certain exceptions. _Instructing Group_ An "Instructing Group" means, subject to certain exceptions as set out in the Intercreditor Agreement, at any time prior to the Senior Discharge Date, the Senior Debt Creditors and the Hedge Counterparties that are owed Senior Hedging Liabilities (together, the "Senior Creditors") representing more than 50% of the Senior Credit Participations (the "Majority Senior Creditors"). _Enforcement of Transaction Security_ The Security Agent may refrain from enforcing the transaction security unless instructed otherwise by the Instructing Group or, if they are entitled to give enforcement instructions in relation to the transaction security in accordance with the paragraph below, the Majority Junior Creditors. Subject to the transaction security having become enforceable in accordance with its terms, the Instructing Group may give or refrain from giving instructions to the Security Agent to enforce or refrain from enforcing the transaction security as they see fit; or, prior to the Senior Discharge Date, if the Instructing Group has instructed the Security Agent not to enforce or to cease enforcing the transaction security or in the absence of instructions from the Instructing Group, and if, in each case, the Instructing Group has not required any Debtor or Third Party Security Provider to make a Distressed Disposal, the Security Agent shall give effect to any instructions to enforce the transaction security which the Majority Junior Creditors are then entitled to give to the Security Agent in certain circumstances and subject to the lapse of certain time periods where applicable as further specified under the Intercreditor Agreement. _Manner of enforcement_ If the transaction security is being enforced in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, the Security Agent shall enforce the relevant transaction security in such manner (including, without limitation, the selection of any administrator (or any analogous officer in any jurisdiction) of any Debtor or Third Party Security Provider to be appointed by the Security Agent) as the Instructing Group or any Junior Creditors entitled to give instructions pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement shall instruct it or, in the absence of any such instructions, as the Security Agent considers in its discretion to be appropriate. The Secured Parties shall not have any independent power to enforce, or have recourse to, any of the transaction security or to exercise any right, power, authority or discretion arising under the Security Documents except through the Security Agent. ----- _Turnover_ Subject to certain exceptions, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that if, at any time prior to the full and final discharge of the Senior Liabilities and Junior Liabilities, any creditor under the Debt Documents receives or recovers from any Debtor, member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider: (a) any payment or distribution of, or on account of or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed to the creditors under the Debt Documents other than any payment or distribution which is either (x) permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement or (y) made in accordance with the provisions set out below under "— _Application of proceeds";_ (b) except with respect to certain set-off rights, any amount by way of set off which does not give effect to a payment permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement; (c) except with respect to certain set-off rights, any amount: i. on account of, or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed to the creditors under the Debt Documents (A) after the occurrence of an acceleration event or the enforcement of any transaction security (a "Distress Event"), or (B) as a result of any other litigation or proceedings against a member of the Group or a Third Party Security Provider (other than after the occurrence of an Insolvency Event (as defined below) in respect of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider); or ii. by way of set off in respect of any such liabilities owed to it after the occurrence of a Distress Event, other than, in each case, any amount received or recovered in accordance with the provisions set out below under "—Application of proceeds"; (d) the proceeds of any enforcement of any of the transaction security except in accordance with the provisions set out below under "—Application of proceeds"; or (e) except with respect to certain set-off rights, any distribution or payment of, or on account of or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed by any member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider which is not in accordance with the provisions set out below under "—Application of proceeds" and which is made as a result of, or after, the occurrence of an Insolvency Event (as defined below) in respect of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider, that creditor will: i. in relation to receipts and recoveries not received or recovered by way of set off: 1. hold an amount of that receipt or recovery equal to the relevant liabilities (or, if less, the amount received or recovered) on trust for the Security Agent and promptly pay or distribute that amount to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, and 2. promptly pay or distribute an amount equal to the amount (if any) by which the receipt or recovery exceeds the relevant liabilities to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement; and ii. in relation to receipts and recoveries received or recovered by way of set off, promptly pay an amount equal to that recovery to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement. "Insolvency Event" includes, in relation to any member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider (a) any resolution is passed or order made for the winding up, dissolution, administration or reorganisation of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider, a moratorium is declared in relation to any indebtedness of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider or an administrator is appointed to that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider; (b) any composition, compromise, assignment or arrangement is made with any of its creditors; (c) the appointment of any liquidator, receiver, administrative receiver, administrator, compulsory manager or other similar officer ----- in respect of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider or any of its assets; or (d) any analogous procedure or step is taken in any jurisdiction.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Application of proceeds
Subsubsection Text: _Order of application—Transaction Security_ Subject to certain provisions set out in the Intercreditor Agreement and to the provisions described below, all amounts from time to time received or recovered by the Security Agent pursuant to the terms of any Debt Document or in connection with the realization or enforcement of all or any part of the transaction security shall be held by the Security Agent on trust to apply them at any time as the Security Agent (in its discretion) sees fit, in the following order of priority: (a) in discharging any sums owed to the Security Agent (other than pursuant to the parallel debt provisions) and any receiver or delegate and in payment to the Creditor Representatives of the relevant creditor representative amounts; (b) in discharging all costs and expenses incurred by any Senior Creditor or Junior Creditor in connection with any realization or enforcement of the transaction security taken in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement or any action taken at the request of the Security Agent under the Intercreditor Agreement; (c) for application towards the discharge of; i. the Senior Facility Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Senior Finance Documents); ii. the Senior Note Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Senior Note Documents); and iii. the Senior Hedging Liabilities (on a pro rata basis between the Senior Hedging Liabilities of each Hedge Counterparty); on a pro rata basis between (1), (2) and (3) above; (d) for application towards the discharge of: i. the Junior Facility Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Junior Finance Documents); ii. the Junior Note Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Junior Note Documents); and iii. the Junior Hedging Liabilities (on a pro rata basis between the Junior Hedging Liabilities of each Hedge Counterparty); on a pro rata basis between (1), (2) and (3) above; (e) if none of the Debtors or, as the case may be, Third Party Security Providers are under any further actual or contingent liability under any Senior Finance Document, Senior Note Document, Hedging Agreement, Junior Finance Document or Junior Note Document, in payment or distribution to any person to whom the Security Agent is obliged to pay or distribute in priority to any Debtor or Third Party Security Provider; and (f) the balance, if any, in payment or distribution to the relevant Debtor or Third Party Security Provider.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Option to purchase
Subsubsection Text: All the Junior Debt Creditors (acting as a whole), may, after a Distress Event and subject to various conditions set out in the Intercreditor Agreement (including the grant of an acceptable indemnity against clawback to the relevant lenders or creditors and payment in relation to all losses incurred by certain other parties as a consequence of any sum received and a simultaneous transfer of each Hedging Agreement with associated rights and obligations), require the transfer to them (or to a nominee or nominees) of all, but not part, of the rights and obligations in respect of the Senior Debt Liabilities at ----- par plus all costs and expenses (including legal fees) incurred by the Senior Agent, the Senior Lenders, the relevant Senior Note Trustee and the Senior Noteholders as a consequence of giving effect to that transfer.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Release of security—non distressed disposals
Subsubsection Text: In circumstances where an asset of a member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider or an asset subject to transaction security is to be disposed of to a person (or persons) outside the Group and which is not a Third Party Security Provider and the Security Agent is notified that such disposal is permitted under the Senior Finance Documents, Senior Note Documents, Junior Finance Documents and Junior Note Documents and that such disposal is not a distressed disposal, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that the Security Agent is irrevocably authorized: - to release the transaction security or any other claim (relating to a Debt Document) over that asset; - where that asset consists of shares in the capital of a member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider, to release the transaction security or any other claim (relating to a Debt Document) over that member of the Group's or Third Party Security Provider's property; and - to execute and deliver or enter into any release of the transaction security or any claim described in the before mentioned paragraphs and issue any certificates of non-crystallization of any floating charge or any consent to dealing that may, in the discretion of the Security Agent, be considered necessary or desirable.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Release of security and guarantees—distressed disposals
Subsubsection Text: In circumstances where an appropriation or a disposal of an asset of a member of the Group or a Third Party Security Provider is being effected (x) at the request of the Instructing Group in circumstances where the transaction security has become enforceable, (y) by enforcement of the transaction security or (z) after the occurrence of a Distress Event to a person or persons which is, or are, not a member, or members, of the Group (a "Distressed Disposal"), the Intercreditor Agreement provides, subject to certain conditions, that the Security Agent is irrevocably authorized: - to release the transaction security or any other claim over the asset subject to the Distressed Disposal or appropriation and execute and deliver or enter into any release of that transaction security or claim and issue any letters of non-crystallization of any floating charge or any consent to dealing that may, in the discretion of the Security Agent, be considered necessary or desirable; - if the asset that is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of a Debtor or Third Party Security Provider, to release (i) that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider and any subsidiary of that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider from all or any part of its borrowing liabilities, guarantee liabilities and certain other liabilities; (ii) any transaction security granted by that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider or any subsidiary of that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider over any of its assets; and (iii) any other claim of an Intra-Group Lender, or another Debtor or another Third Party Security Provider over that Debtor's or Third Party Security Provider's assets or over the assets of any Subsidiary of that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider; - if the asset that is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of any holding company of a Debtor, to release (i) that holding company and any subsidiary of that holding company from all or any part of its borrowing liabilities, guarantee liabilities and certain other liabilities, (ii) any transaction security granted by any subsidiary of that holding company over any of its assets, and (iii) any other claim of an Intra-Group Lender or another Debtor over the assets of any subsidiary of that holding company; - if the asset which is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of a Debtor or any holding company of a Debtor, to dispose of (i) all or any part of the Liabilities (other than liabilities due to the Senior Agent, Senior Arrangers or any Senior Note Trustee), or (ii) intra-group receivables provided that the transferee shall not be treated as a Senior Creditor, a Junior Creditor or a Secured Party under the Intercreditor Agreement; - if the asset which is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of a Debtor or any holding company of a Debtor, to dispose of (i) the Liabilities (other than liabilities due to any Senior Agent, Senior Arrangers or any Senior Note Trustee), or (ii) intra-group receivables, where the transferee of such Liabilities shall become a Senior Creditor, a Junior Creditor or Secured Party provided that such ----- transfer is in respect of all (and not part only) of such Liabilities and/or intra-group receivables, as appliable; and - if the asset which is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of a Debtor or any holding company of a Debtor, to transfer Intra-Group Liabilities or intra-group receivables owed by that Debtor or holding company of a Debtor to another Debtor. Any net proceeds of the disposal must be applied in accordance with the enforcement proceeds waterfall described under "—Application of proceeds."

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Accession of New Intra-Group Lenders
Subsubsection Text: If any Intra-Group Lender or any member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider makes any loan to or grants any credit to or makes any other financial arrangement having similar effect with any Debtor, in an aggregate amount of €3,000,000 or more, the Issuer will procure that the person giving that loan, granting that credit or making that other financial arrangement (if not already a party as an Intra-Group Lender) accedes to the Intercreditor Agreement as an IntraGroup Lender.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Amendment
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement provides that, subject to certain exceptions, its terms may be amended or waived only with the consent of the facility agents, the Majority Senior Lenders, the Majority Senior Noteholders, the Majority Junior Lenders, the Majority Junior Noteholders and the Security Agent. However, to the extent that an amendment, waiver or consent in relation to certain equalisation provisions does not affect the Junior Creditors, those provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement may be amended or waived, subject to certain exceptions, with the consent of the senior agent, the Majority Senior Lenders, the Majority Senior Noteholders and the Security Agent. An amendment or waiver of the Intercreditor Agreement that has the effect of changing or which relates to, among other matters, the provisions set out under "—Application of proceeds" above and the order of priority or subordination under the Intercreditor Agreement shall not be made without the consent of each of the Facility Agents, the Senior Lenders, each Senior Note Trustee on behalf of the Senior Noteholders in respect of which it is the Creditor Representative, the Junior Lenders, each Junior Note Trustee on behalf of the Junior Noteholders in respect of which it is the Creditor Representative, each Hedge Counterparty (to the extent that the amendment or waiver would adversely affect the Hedge Counterparty) and the Security Agent. The Intercreditor Agreement includes provisions which can result in a party's participation being deemed to be zero for the purpose of calculating the percentage of necessary consents by the members of a relevant group in regard to amendments and waivers if that party fails to respond to that request within ten business days of that consent request being made or (in the case of a Senior Creditor, in relation to certain requests) fails to provide details of its participations to the Security Agent within the period specified by the Security Agent.. The Intercreditor Agreement also permits (or in some cases, requires) the Security Agent (subject to the terms of any credit facility) to enter into new or supplemental security if certain conditions are met, including in connection with uncommitted facilities established under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement, and to amend or release Transaction Security with the prior consent of, inter alia, the Senior Facility Creditors whose consent to that amendment or release is required under any Senior Facilities Agreement.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Title: Governing law
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it are governed by English law.

Subsection Title: Agreement") originally dated 7 January 2020 and entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders
Subsubsection Text: under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement and others (as amended or amended and restated from time to time, including as most recently amended and restated by an amendment and restatement agreement dated 21 September 2023). The Intercreditor Agreement governs, _inter alia, the relationships and relative priorities among (i) the creditors and arrangers under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement; (ii) the creditor under the EIB Loan Agreement (who acceded to the Intercreditor Agreement as senior lender and senior facility creditor); (iii) the holders of the Existing Notes and the trustee (who acceded to the Intercreditor Agreement as creditor representative and became a senior note trustee) in respect of the Existing Notes; (iv) the holders of the Notes and the Trustee (who will accede to the Intercreditor Agreement as creditor representative and will become a senior note trustee); (v) existing and future hedge counterparties under certain hedging agreements (the "Hedge Counterparties"); (vi) certain shareholder loan creditors, third party security providers, intra-group lenders and debtors; (vii) certain other future creditors of the Group and/or such creditors representatives that may accede to the Intercreditor Agreement from time to time in accordance with its terms; and (viii) the Security Agent. By accepting a Note, holders of the Notes will be deemed to have agreed to, and accepted the terms and conditions of, the Intercreditor Agreement. The following description of certain provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement summarizes certain provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement. It does not restate the Intercreditor Agreement in its entirety nor does it describe provisions relating to the rights and obligations of holders of other classes of our debt. As such, we urge you to read the Intercreditor Agreement because it, and not the general overview that follows, defines the rights of the holders of the Notes. Please note that certain provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement that are stated as applying generally to all types of liabilities are subject to certain exceptions specified in the Intercreditor Agreement. Accordingly, certain provisions will not apply to these exceptions. Such exceptions include but are not limited to cash cover provided under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement or any future senior facilities agreements (a "Permitted Senior Facilities Agreement").

In June 2023, the Group entered into the Trade Receivables Purchase Program pursuant to which the Group sells a portion of its accounts receivables from operating businesses in certain jurisdictions in return for funding. Receivables are only eligible for sale if they meet certain criteria. As at December 31, 2023, €54.8 million in financing was outstanding under the Trade Receivable Purchase Program (which may be increased to €75 million as permitted under the Trade Receivables Purchase Program). The Trade Receivables Purchase Program is secured on a senior basis by certain collection accounts for trade receivables in Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands, that will not secure the Notes. For further detail, see Note 16 of the FY 2023 Financial Statements. -----

_Set forth below is a summary of certain of our future significant debt arrangements. The following summary does not purport to be complete and is subject to, and qualified in its entirety by reference to, the underlying documents. The defined terms set forth in this section apply to this section only._

Subsection Title: Agent"), in private transactions that are not subject to the registration requirements of the U.S. Securities Act of 1933, as
Subsubsection Text: amended (the "U.S. **Securities Act"). The terms of the Notes include those set forth in the Indenture. The Indenture is unlimited in aggregate principal amount, of which €500,000,000 aggregate principal amount of Notes will be issued in this Offering. We may in the future, subject to applicable law, issue an unlimited principal amount of Additional Notes (as defined below). We will only be permitted to issue Additional Notes in compliance with the covenants contained in the Indenture. The Notes and any Additional Notes will be treated as a single class for all purposes under the Indenture, including, without limitation, with respect to waivers, amendments, redemptions and offers to purchase, except as otherwise provided for in the Indenture. The following description is a summary of the material terms of the Notes and the Indenture, and refers to the Intercreditor Agreement and the Security Documents. It does not, however, restate the Notes and the Indenture in their entirety and where reference is made to a particular provision of the Notes or the Indenture, such reference, including the definitions of certain terms, is qualified in its entirety by reference to all of the provisions of the Notes, the Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement and the Security Documents. The Indenture, the Notes and the Guarantees will be subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and any Additional Intercreditor Agreement entered into in the future. The terms of the Intercreditor Agreement are important to understanding the terms and ranking of the Notes and the Guarantees. See the section entitled "Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement." You should read the Notes, the Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement and the Security Documents because they contain additional information and because they and not this description define your rights as a Holder of the Notes. The Indenture is not qualified under, does not incorporate provisions by reference to, and is not otherwise subject to, the U.S. Trust Indenture Act of 1939, as amended, including Section 316(b) thereof. Application will be made to The International Stock Exchange Authority Limited (the "Authority") for listing of and permission to deal in the Notes on the Official List of The International Stock Exchange (the "Exchange"). In the event that the Notes are admitted to trading on an exchange other than the Exchange, references herein to the Exchange shall be deemed to be to the relevant exchange upon which the Notes are listed. The Issuer can provide no assurance that this application will be accepted. See "—Payments on the Notes; Paying Agent, Transfer Agent and Registrar." The registered Holder of a Note will be treated as the owner of it for all purposes. Only registered Holders will have rights under the Indenture. Each reference to a legal entity herein shall be deemed to include such entity's successor in interest, unless the context requires otherwise.

Subsection Title: Brief Description of the Structure and Ranking of the Notes and the Guarantees
Subsubsection Title: The Notes
Subsubsection Text: The Notes will: - be the Issuer's general, senior obligations; - be secured as set forth under "—Security," on a pari passu basis with the interests granted in favor of the Existing Notes, the EIB Facility and the Existing Senior Facilities and certain hedging obligations; - rank pari passu in right of payment with any existing and future obligations of the Issuer that are not expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Notes, including the Issuer's obligations under the Existing Notes, the EIB Facility and the Existing Senior Facilities; ----- - rank senior in right of payment to any existing and future obligations of the Issuer that are expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Notes; - be effectively senior to any existing and future obligations of the Issuer that are not secured by the Collateral, to the extent of the value of such Collateral; - be effectively subordinated to any existing or future obligations of the Issuer and its subsidiaries that are secured by property or assets that do not secure the Notes, to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such obligations; - be structurally subordinated to any existing or future obligations of the subsidiaries of the Issuer that are not Guarantors, including obligations owed to trade creditors; and - be guaranteed on a senior joint and several basis by the Guarantors.

Subsection Title: Brief Description of the Structure and Ranking of the Notes and the Guarantees
Subsubsection Title: The Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: The Notes will be guaranteed on a senior secured basis by (a) on or about the Issue Date and, in any case, within 30 days following the Issue Date, the Initial Guarantors and (b) within 120 days following the Completion Date, the PostCompletion Guarantors. Each Guarantee of a Guarantor will: - be a general senior obligation of such Guarantor; - be secured as set forth under "—Security," on a pari passu basis with the interests granted in favor of the Existing Notes, the EIB Facility and the Existing Senior Facilities and certain hedging obligations; - rank pari passu in right of payment with any existing and future obligations of the relevant Guarantor that are not expressly subordinated in right of payment to such Guarantee, including such Guarantor's obligations under the Existing Notes, the EIB Facility and the Existing Senior Facilities; - rank senior in right of payment to any existing and future obligations of such Guarantor that are expressly subordinated in right of payment to such Guarantee; - be effectively senior to any existing and future obligations of the applicable Guarantor that are not secured by the Collateral owned by such Guarantor, to the extent of the value of such Collateral; - be effectively subordinated to any existing or future obligations of such Guarantor that are secured by property or assets that do not secure such Guarantee to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such other obligations; - be structurally subordinated to any existing or future obligations of the subsidiaries of such Guarantor that do not provide Guarantees, including obligations owed to trade creditors; and - be subject to the limitations described herein and in "Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes, the _Guarantees and Our Structure—Each Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defenses that may limit its validity and enforceability" and "Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Security and the Guarantees and Certain Insolvency Law Considerations."_

Subsection Title: Brief Description of the Structure and Ranking of the Notes and the Guarantees
Subsubsection Title: General
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer is partially dependent upon cash flows from its subsidiaries to meet its obligations under the Notes. See "Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and Our Structure—The Issuer depends upon cash flow _from subsidiaries to meet its obligations on the Notes and the Guarantees."_ Not all of the Issuer's direct and indirect Subsidiaries will guarantee the Notes. As of and for the year ended December 31, 2023, the Issuer and the Guarantors represented 77% of our Reported EBITDA (excluding entities with negative Reported EBITDA), 73% of our revenue and 82% of our total assets (including goodwill), in each case, based on management estimates as adjusted for the Acquisition. See "Risk Factors—Financial Risks—We present information _relating to Adjusted EBITDA, Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA and other non-IFRS measures in this Offering Memorandum; certain of the data used in calculating this information was unaudited or involved certain estimates and judgments, and accordingly you should not unduly rely on them."_ ----- The Notes are effectively subordinated in right of payment to all Debt and other liabilities and commitments (including trade payables and lease obligations) of the Issuer's Subsidiaries that are not Guarantors. Any right of the Issuer to receive assets of any of its Subsidiaries upon the Subsidiary's liquidation or reorganization (and the consequent right of the Holders to participate in those assets) will be effectively subordinated to the claims of that Subsidiary's creditors, except to the extent that the Issuer is itself recognized as a creditor of the Subsidiary, in which case the claims of the Issuer would still be subordinated in right of payment to any security over the assets of the Subsidiary and any Debt of the Subsidiary senior to that held by the Issuer. The obligations of a Guarantor under its Guarantee will be limited as necessary to prevent the relevant Guarantee from constituting a fraudulent conveyance or unlawful financial assistance or infringement of capital maintenance rules under applicable law, otherwise to reflect limitations under applicable law or as set out in the respective Guarantee. By virtue of these limitations, a Guarantor's obligation under its Guarantee could be significantly less than amounts payable with respect to the Notes, or a Guarantor may have effectively no obligation under its Guarantee. See "Risk Factors—Risks _Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and Our Structure—Each Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defenses that may limit its validity and enforceability." The validity and enforceability of the Guarantees and the liability of each Guarantor will be subject to_ the limitations described in this Offering Memorandum under the caption "Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of _the Security and the Guarantees and Certain Insolvency Law Considerations."_ As of the Issue Date, all of the Issuer's Subsidiaries will be "Restricted Subsidiaries." Under the circumstances described below under "—Certain Covenants—Designation of Unrestricted and Restricted Subsidiaries," the Issuer will be permitted to designate certain of its Subsidiaries as "Unrestricted Subsidiaries." Unrestricted Subsidiaries of the Issuer will not be subject to the restrictive covenants in the Indenture. Further, Unrestricted Subsidiaries of the Issuer will not Guarantee the Notes. Although the Indenture will contain limitations on the amount of additional Debt that the Issuer, the Guarantors and the Restricted Subsidiaries may incur, the amount of such additional Debt could be substantial. The Indenture will permit additional Debt to be secured.

The Notes will mature on     , 2030 unless redeemed prior thereto as described herein. The Issuer will issue the Notes in the aggregate principal amount of €500,000,000. Each Note will bear interest at a rate per annum of      % and interest will be payable semi-annually on      and      of each year, commencing on     , 2024. Interest will be payable to Holders of record on each Note in respect of the principal amount thereof outstanding as at the Clearing System Business Day immediately preceding the payment date, as the case may be; however, owners of beneficial interests in the Notes must rely on the procedures of Euroclear or Clearstream, as applicable. See "Risk Factors—Risks Related to the _Notes, the Guarantees and Our Structure—The Notes will initially be held in book-entry form, and therefore you must rely on the procedures of the relevant clearing systems to exercise any rights and remedies." If the due date for any payment in_ respect of the Notes is not a Business Day or a business day at the place at which such payment is due to be paid, the Holder thereof will not be entitled to payment of the amount due until the next succeeding Business Day at such place, and will not be entitled to any further interest or other payment as a result of any such delay. The rights of Holders in beneficial interest of the Notes to receive the payments on such Notes are subject to applicable procedures of Euroclear and/or Clearstream. Interest on the Notes will accrue from, and including, the original issuance date or, if interest has already been paid, from the date it was most recently paid. Interest will be computed on the basis of a 360-day year comprised of twelve 30-day months on the aggregate nominal amount outstanding.

The Notes will be issued only in fully registered form without coupons and only in denominations of €100,000 and integral multiples of €1,000 in excess thereof. Notes sold within the United States to qualified institutional buyers pursuant to Rule 144A under the U.S. Securities Act ("Rule 144A") will initially be represented by one or more global Notes in registered form without interest coupons attached (the "144A Global Notes"), and Notes sold outside the United States pursuant to Regulation S under the U.S. Securities Act ("Regulation S") will initially be represented by one or more global Notes in registered form without interest coupons attached (the "Regulation S Global Notes" and, together with the 144A Global Notes, the "Global

The Global Notes will be deposited with a common depositary for Euroclear and Clearstream and registered in the name of the nominee of such common depositary. Ownership of interests in the Global Notes, referred to in this ----- description as "book-entry interests," will be limited to persons that have accounts with Euroclear or Clearstream or their respective participants. The terms of the Indenture will provide for the issuance of Definitive Registered Notes in certain limited circumstances. See "Book-Entry; Delivery and Form."

The Notes will be subject to certain restrictions on transfer and certification requirements, as described under "Notice to Investors." A Holder may transfer or exchange Notes in accordance with the Indenture and the procedures of Euroclear and Clearstream. Upon any transfer or exchange, the Issuer, the Agents and/or the Trustee may require a Holder, among other things, to furnish appropriate endorsements and transfer documents and the Issuer may require a Holder to pay any taxes or other governmental charges payable in connection with the transfer or exchange. The Issuer will not be required to transfer or exchange any Note selected for redemption or repurchase or to transfer or exchange any Note for a period of 15 Business Days prior to any date on which all or any part of the Notes are to be redeemed or repurchased. The Notes will be issued in registered form and the Holder will be treated as the owner of such Note for all purposes. For further information about transfer and exchange procedures, see the section titled "Book-Entry; Delivery and Form." Book-entry interests in the 144A Global Notes may be transferred to a person who takes delivery in the form of book-entry interests in the Regulation S Global Note only upon delivery by the transferor of a written certification (in the form provided in the Indenture) to the effect that such transfer is being made in accordance with Regulation S. Book-entry interests in the Regulation S Global Notes may be transferred to a person who takes delivery in the form of book-entry interests in the 144A Global Note only upon delivery by the transferor of a written certification (in the form provided in the Indenture) to the effect that such transfer is being made to a person who the transferor reasonably believes is a "qualified institutional buyer" within the meaning of Rule 144A) in a transaction meeting the requirements of Rule 144A. Any book-entry interest that is transferred as described in the immediately preceding paragraphs will, upon transfer, cease to be a book-entry interest in the Global Note from which it was transferred and will become a book-entry interest in the Global Note to which it was transferred. Accordingly, from and after such transfer, it will become subject to all transfer restrictions, if any, and other procedures applicable to book-entry interests in the Global Note to which it was transferred. All transfers of book-entry interests between participants in Euroclear or Clearstream will be effected by Euroclear or Clearstream pursuant to customary procedures and subject to applicable rules and procedures established by Euroclear or Clearstream and their respective participants. See "Book-Entry; Delivery and Form."

Subsection Title: Payments on the Notes; Paying Agent, Transfer Agent and Registrar
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer will make all payments, including principal of, premium, if any, and interest on the Notes, at its office or through its agent that it will maintain for these purposes. Initially, that agent will be The Bank of New York Mellon, London Branch (the "Paying Agent"). The Issuer may change the Paying Agent without prior notice to the Holders. The Issuer will make all payments in same-day funds. The Issuer will also maintain a registrar (the "Registrar") and a transfer agent (the "Transfer Agent"). The initial Registrar and the initial Transfer Agent will be The Bank of New York Mellon SA/NV, Dublin Branch. The Registrar will maintain a register reflecting ownership of the Notes outstanding from time to time, if any, and together with the Transfer Agent, will facilitate transfers of the Notes on behalf of the Issuer. A register of the Notes shall be left at the registered office of the Issuer. In case of inconsistency between the register of Notes kept by the Registrar and the one kept by the Issuer at its registered office, the register kept by the Issuer shall prevail. The Registrar has no responsibility for any register maintained by the Issuer. The Issuer may change any Paying Agent, Registrar or Transfer Agent for the Notes without prior notice to the Holders of such Notes. However, for so long as they are admitted to trading on the Official List of the Exchange and the rules and regulations of the Authority so require, the Issuer will publish a notice of any change of Paying Agent, Registrar or Transfer Agent to the extent and in the manner permitted by such rules and regulations. In addition, for so long as any Notes are represented by Global Notes, such notices to Holders of the Notes may be delivered by or on behalf of the Issuer to Euroclear and Clearstream. ----- Holders will not be responsible for any service charge for any registration of transfer, exchange or redemption of the Notes, but the Issuer may require payment of a sum sufficient to cover any transfer tax or similar governmental charge payable in connection with any such registration of transfer or exchange.

From time to time, subject to the Issuer's compliance with the covenants described under the headings "—Certain _Covenants—Limitation on Debt" and "—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Liens," the Issuer is permitted to issue_ additional Notes ("Additional Notes"), which shall have the terms set out in an Officer's Certificate supplied to the Trustee. The Notes (together with any Additional Notes of such series issued from time to time) will constitute separate series of Notes, but will be treated, along with all other series of Notes, as a single class for the purposes of the Indenture with respect to waivers, amendments and all other matters which are not specifically distinguished for such series.
